etymologies: mid 19th century: from modern Latin Pliosaurus (genus name), from Greek pleiōn ‘more’ + sauros ‘lizard’ (because of its greater similarity to a lizard than the ichthyosaur)

definitions: a plesiosaur with a short neck, large head, and massive toothed jaws.

notes.text: Family Pliosauridae, infraorder Plesiosauria: several genera, including Pliosaurus

shortDefinitions: plesiosaur with short neck, large head
